description.zh-cn: 清朝末期政治人物，光绪帝异母弟，宣统帝溥仪生父。宣统年间担任监国摄政王，是清朝最后的实际统治者之一。
description.en: A political figure in the late Qing dynasty, half-brother of the Guangxu Emperor, and father of the Xuantong Emperor (Puyi). He served as the Prince-Regent during the Xuantong era, making him one of the last de facto rulers of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 道光皇帝第七子，载沣与光绪帝之父。
description.en: The seventh son of the Daoguang Emperor, and the father of Zaifeng and the Guangxu Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 醇贤亲王奕𫍽的侧福晋，载沣的生母。
description.en: A secondary consort of Yixuan, Prince Chun, and the biological mother of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第十一位皇帝，奕𫍽第二子，载沣的异母兄。
description.en: The eleventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, the second son of Yixuan, and the half-brother of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝，也是中国历史上最后一位皇帝。载沣长子。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty and the final emperor of China. He was the eldest son of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末期的实际统治者，指定溥仪继位并任命载沣为摄政王。
description.en: The de facto ruler of the late Qing dynasty who appointed Puyi as the successor to the throne and Zaifeng as the Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 光绪帝的皇后，宣统年间与载沣共同作为清朝最高统治者，拥有重大事件的最终决定权。
description.en: The empress of the Guangxu Emperor. During the Xuantong era, she was the co-supreme ruler of the Qing dynasty with Zaifeng, holding the final decision-making power on major events.

description.zh-cn: 载沣的元配嫡福晋，大学士荣禄之女。
description.en: The primary consort of Zaifeng and the daughter of the Grand Secretary Ronglu.

description.zh-cn: 清末重臣，慈禧太后的心腹，载沣的岳父。
description.en: A prominent minister in the late Qing dynasty, a confidant of Empress Dowager Cixi, and the father-in-law of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事及政治人物。武昌起义后组成责任内阁，并劝说隆裕太后迫使载沣辞职。
description.en: A military and political figure during the late Qing and early Republican era. He formed a responsible cabinet after the Wuchang Uprising and persuaded Empress Dowager Longyu to force Zaifeng's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命党人，曾策划暗杀时任摄政王的载沣。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary who once plotted the assassination of the then Prince-Regent Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清末重臣，建议慈禧太后给予载沣“摄政王”的封号。
description.en: A prominent minister in the late Qing dynasty who suggested to Empress Dowager Cixi that Zaifeng be given the title of 'Prince-Regent'.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末年为辅佐幼帝宣统帝而设立的职位，由载沣担任。
description.en: A position established in the late Qing dynasty to assist the young Xuantong Emperor, held by Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命的开端，直接导致了清朝的覆灭和载沣摄政体制的瓦解。
description.en: The beginning of the Xinhai Revolution, which directly led to the fall of the Qing dynasty and the collapse of Zaifeng's regency.

description.zh-cn: 推翻清朝、建立中华民国的全国性革命。载沣在此期间顺应潮流辞去摄政王之职。
description.en: A nationwide revolution that overthrew the Qing dynasty and established the Republic of China. During this period, Zaifeng resigned from his position as Prince-Regent in response to the changing times.

description.zh-cn: 载沣次子，溥仪之弟。
description.en: The second son of Zaifeng and the younger brother of Puyi.

description.zh-cn: 载沣第四子。
description.en: The fourth son of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第八位皇帝，载沣的祖父。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Qing dynasty, grandfather of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 清代醇亲王奕𫍽及其子载沣的府邸，也是载沣的出生地。
description.en: The mansion of Prince Chun Yixuan and his son Zaifeng in the Qing dynasty, and also the birthplace of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 中国首都，载沣长期居住及逝世的地点。
description.en: The capital of China, where Zaifeng lived for a long time and passed away.

description.zh-cn: 1910年革命党人汪精卫等人密谋在北京银锭桥暗杀摄政王载沣的事件。
description.en: An event in 1910 where revolutionaries including Wang Jingwei plotted to assassinate the Prince-Regent Zaifeng at Yinding Bridge in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 1900年在中国发生的一场以“扶清灭洋”为口号的农民运动。事变后，载沣被派往德国为德国公使被杀一事道歉。
description.en: A peasant movement in China in 1900 with the slogan 'Support the Qing, exterminate the foreigners.' After the incident, Zaifeng was sent to Germany to apologize for the killing of the German minister.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末年的国家银行，其发行的兑换券上印有摄政王载沣的肖像。
description.en: The state bank of the late Qing dynasty, which issued banknotes featuring the portrait of Prince-Regent Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个封建王朝，由满族建立。载沣是其最后的实际统治者之一。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty in Chinese history, established by the Manchu people. Zaifeng was one of its last de facto rulers.

description.zh-cn: 载沣是醇贤亲王奕𫍽的第五子。
description.en: Zaifeng was the fifth son of Yixuan, Prince Chun the First.

description.zh-cn: 载沣的生母是奕𫍽的侧福晋刘佳氏。
description.en: Zaifeng's biological mother was Yixuan's secondary consort, Lady Liuja.

description.zh-cn: 奕𫍽是道光皇帝的第七子。
description.en: Yixuan was the seventh son of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 载沣是光绪帝（载湉）的异母弟。
description.en: Zaifeng was the younger half-brother of the Guangxu Emperor (Zaitian).

description.zh-cn: 嫡福晋瓜尔佳氏是载沣的元配妻子。
description.en: Primary Consort Gūwalgiya was Zaifeng's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 嫡福晋瓜尔佳氏是大学士荣禄之女。
description.en: Primary Consort Gūwalgiya was the daughter of the Grand Secretary Ronglu.

description.zh-cn: 宣统帝（溥仪）是载沣的长子。
description.en: The Xuantong Emperor (Puyi) was the eldest son of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 溥杰是载沣的次子。
description.en: Pujie was the second son of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 溥任是载沣的第四子。
description.en: Puren was the fourth son of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 光绪帝驾崩后，慈禧太后发布懿旨，指定载沣长子溥仪入嗣大统，成为宣统帝。
description.en: After the death of the Guangxu Emperor, Empress Dowager Cixi issued an edict appointing Zaifeng's eldest son, Puyi, as the successor to the throne, becoming the Xuantong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后在临终前发布懿旨，授载沣为摄政王，监国辅佐幼帝。
description.en: Before her death, Empress Dowager Cixi issued an edict appointing Zaifeng as the Prince-Regent to govern and assist the young emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在决定权力交接时，张之洞建议给予载沣摄政王的封号，并被慈禧太后采纳。
description.en: During the power transition, Zhang Zhidong suggested giving Zaifeng the title of Prince-Regent, which was adopted by Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 载沣在宣统年间担任监国摄政王，辅佐其子宣统帝。
description.en: Zaifeng served as the Prince-Regent during the Xuantong era, assisting his son, the Xuantong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 根据慈禧太后的安排，载沣作为摄政王在遇到重大事件时，需请示隆裕太后懿旨施行。
description.en: According to Empress Dowager Cixi's arrangements, Zaifeng, as the Prince-Regent, was required to seek instructions from Empress Dowager Longyu for implementation when encountering major events.

description.zh-cn: 1910年，汪精卫策划了“银锭桥案”，企图暗杀摄政王载沣，但未能成功。
description.en: In 1910, Wang Jingwei plotted the 'Yinding Bridge Incident' in an unsuccessful attempt to assassinate the Prince-Regent Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义的爆发动摇了清朝的统治，导致载沣的摄政权力迅速瓦解。
description.en: The outbreak of the Wuchang Uprising shook the rule of the Qing dynasty, leading to the rapid collapse of Zaifeng's regency power.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯向隆裕太后进言，最终使太后命令载沣辞去摄政王职位。
description.en: Yuan Shikai advised Empress Dowager Longyu, ultimately leading her to order Zaifeng to resign from his position as Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 在袁世凯的劝说下，隆裕太后命令载沣辞去监国摄政王职位。
description.en: Persuaded by Yuan Shikai, Empress Dowager Longyu ordered Zaifeng to resign from his position as Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 在辛亥革命的浪潮中，载沣被迫辞去监国摄政王的职务。
description.en: In the tide of the Xinhai Revolution, Zaifeng was forced to resign from his position as Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 作为清朝的实际统治者，载沣的肖像被印在1910年大清银行发行的兑换券上。
description.en: As the de facto ruler of the Qing dynasty, Zaifeng's portrait was printed on the exchange notes issued by the Ta-Ching Government Bank in 1910.

description.zh-cn: 庚子事变后，载沣被授为头等专使，赴德国为德国公使被杀一事道歉。
description.en: After the Boxer Rebellion, Zaifeng was appointed as a first-class special envoy to Germany to apologize for the killing of the German minister.

description.zh-cn: 载沣是清朝皇族成员，并担任过军机大臣、监国摄政王等要职。
description.en: Zaifeng was a member of the Qing imperial family and held important positions such as Grand Councilor and Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 载沣于光绪九年（1883年）出生于北京太平湖醇亲王府。
description.en: Zaifeng was born in the Prince Chun Mansion at Taiping Lake, Beijing, in 1883 (the 9th year of the Guangxu reign).

description.zh-cn: 载沣在北京病故，并葬于北京西郊福田公墓。
description.en: Zaifeng died of illness in Beijing and was buried in the Futian Cemetery in the western suburbs of Beijing.
